result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A. Salmon

records.addlTxt:
Victim has requested to be present at all proceedings.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Victim has requested to present at sentencing hearing.

10:42 AM Defendant Kevin A. Salmon appeared by video.  Attorney David Kennedy Anderson appeared by video for Kevin A. Salmon.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:11 PM Defendant Kevin A. Salmon appeared by video.  Attorney David Kennedy Anderson appeared by video for Kevin A. Salmon.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1,000 with conditions with no contact with Sentry Foods.  Bond to be signed by end of week of October 10, 2022. Preliminary Hearing requested, time limits waived by zoom video.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
